snippet: The new bill applies only in cases in which people lie about a military record with the aim of obtaining payment or other benefits.
abstract: House passes legislation that criminalizes lying about military service or about receiving medals with the intent of benefiting from those claims; bill comes less than three months after the Supreme Court struck down the original act on the grounds that it violated the First Amendment.
lead_paragraph: The new bill applies only in cases in which people lie about a military record with the aim of obtaining payment or other benefits.

headline.main: House Tries Again, Passing New Stolen Valor Act
headline.print_headline: House Tries Again, Passing New Stolen Valor Act

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
